Job_Description:
Job Description

Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Uniquely Yours.
About This Role
This is a fantastic opportunity for a highly enthusiastic, experienced, and driven QA Engineering Practice Lead to make a real impact in defining Mondelez’s QA Engineering Strategy and continuing to build out the test automation framework within this business. With full accountability for QA Strategy and Automation you will be looked upon as an expert in this field, someone who will help identify, select, and develop appropriate automation tools and frameworks we use moving forward, applying the latest techniques and evaluating the latest technologies.

Title: Sr. Consumer Scientist I
Job_Description:
Job Description
Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?
Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride.
Under the indirect supervision of a manager, you plan and organize cross-functional projects and develop consumer-centric objectives and strategies in response to business needs. You also interact independently with senior management and stakeholders.
How you will contribute
You will deliver on single or multi-stage complex projects, meeting standards and time frames by designing research and producing quality, actionable data. You will lead all aspects of qualitative and quantitative consumer research and ensure that the data gleaned is translated into a cohesive story. To that end, you will interpret results, report and present findings, and make recommendations that contribute to decision making. In this role, you may also lead descriptive panels, training, data analysis, reporting and assess panelist’s performance, interact with your peers, junior developers/marketing and other colleagues, and may take on supervisory responsibility when completing assignments. This role requires and understanding and the application of multivariate statistical methods to gain deeper understanding and insights from the research. Teamwork is essential in this position because you will participate on teams where new methodologies and capabilities are evaluated, proposed and implemented. You will partner with key stakeholders (R&D and commercial/insights) to ensure that the work is aligned with strategic priorities and ensure that procedures are followed and the highest standards of work and environment, health and safety are maintained.
Regular
Consumer Science
Science & Engineering

Title: Sr. Consumer Scientist I
Job_Description:
Overview:
IDC is seeking a Research Vice President (RVP) covering Storage, Converged, Hyperconverged and Composable Infrastructure. Reporting to the GVP/GM for the Infrastructure Systems, Platforms and Technologies and Buyer View Group, the RVP will be a key face of IDC’s market intelligence and advisory services on Enterprise IT and Cloud Infrastructure. We are looking for candidates with the experience and skills needed to help IDC’s clients bring innovative infrastructure products and services to market. The RVP will have a broad and in-depth knowledge of the enterprise IT and cloud infrastructure industry with a specific focus on Systems, Platforms and Technologies, Vendor landscape, and Use cases and workloads.

A successful RVP will become an important member within a team of industry experts and will be looked upon as a frequent contributor to IDC’s enterprise and cloud IT infrastructure services research.



Responsibilities:
Qualifications:

Title: Sr. Consumer Scientist I
Job_Description:
Overview:
IDC is seeking a Research Manager who will be responsible for covering the ongoing trends, opportunities, and competitive landscape in the Unified Communications & Collaboration (UC&C) market. IDC's Worldwide Unified Communications team within the Network and Telecommunications Group is looking for an individual who is deeply knowledgeable on the UC&C market. Knowledge of UC&C technologies and strategies should include familiarity of current trends, major providers in the hardware, software and as-a-service subsegments of the UC&C market, including on-prem and cloud-based solutions, as well as be familiar with the role that UCaaS Service providers play in this segment.

This position carries the expectation the individual will author a mix of shorter industry-event reactive pieces as well as lengthier market trend and thought leadership documents that provide deeper insight into the changing nature of the market. The ability to build relationships with vendors and to reach out to industry representatives proactively is critical. This position will possibly support forecasts and quantitative deliverables in the future.



Responsibilities:
Qualifications:

Title: Sr. Consumer Scientist I
Job_Description:
Overview:
IDC is seeking a Research Vice President, Communications Service Provider Operations for our Worldwide Network and Telecommunications group. The dynamic individual, being knowledgeable about IT operations in the Telecom and Communications SP segment, will be responsible for the market research agenda and consulting as it relates to ongoing technology and digital transformation amongst service providers. Domain knowledge of OSS/BSS, service assurance, fulfillment, orchestration and monetization domains especially as they relate to the ongoing telecom operations transformation initiatives is a key requirement for this position.

Digital transformation and a rapidly changing competitive landscape is motivating service providers to evolve faster than ever before, while embracing many of the learnings from cloud and network virtualization, including the ability to leverage open source across the infrastructure stack. Providing thought leadership around these industry shifts, what these mean to operators and vendors, and substantiating with quantitative and qualitative analysis is a key to the success of this position.



Responsibilities:
Qualifications:

Title: Sr. Consumer Scientist I
Job_Description:
Overview:
IDC is seeking a Research Manager with experience in financial management software and/or financial management operations to join the IDC team to conduct primary research, engage in quantitative research management, client engagement and business development. The Research Manager will establish and maintain a strong industry presence as a financial management software thought leader, including working with the general business and technology trade press. It is essential for the Research Manager to bring an innovative and creative perspective on the role technology is playing in the constantly changing financial software markets.

Why IDC?

IDC is the most respected global technology market research firm. We are changing the way the world thinks about the impact of technology on business and society. Our people, data, and analytics create global technology insights that accelerate customer success.

Responsibilities:
Qualifications:

Title: Sr. Consumer Scientist I
Job_Description:
Overview:
IDC is seeking a Research Manager to join our CMO Advisory practice. This is an opportunity for an experienced analyst or practitioner turned analyst, to help contribute and grow our CMO Advisory practice. The Research Manager is responsible for contributing to our syndicated research, building relationships with our strategic clients, and providing domain expertise of B2B marketing practices and operations.

The CMO Advisory practice focuses on helping companies achieve their business goals through a better connection with today's empowered customer and the application of management science to the transforming marketing function. The research agenda includes both quantitative and qualitative studies including an annual benchmark of B2B marketing spending, deeper dives into specific topics (i.e. Future of B2B Marketing, Event Marketing in COVID's wake), and an annual B2B Tech Buyer behavior and preference study.



Responsibilities:


Qualifications:

Title: Sr. Consumer Scientist I
Job_Description:
Overview:
IDC is seeking a Research Director with experience in Finance and within the Office of the Chief Financial Officer (CFO), to join the IDC team to conduct primary research, engage in quantitative research management, client engagement and business development. The Research Director will establish and maintain a strong presence within the technology and services spending areas around the Office of the CFOs buying preferences for the organization overall. This Research Director thought leader will look at the evolving dynamics of the Office of the CFO as it relates towards the future of the digital enterprise including technology and services objectives, priorities, programs, and investments. This individual should also be familiar with Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) as it pertains to the Office of the CFO. This individual will also work closely with the general business and technology trade press. It is essential for the Research Director to bring an innovative and creative perspective on the role technology and services are playing in the constantly evolving Office of the CFO.

Qualifications:

Job Description
Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?
Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Uniquely Yours.
About This Role
In this job, you’ll be leading planning, implementing, and embedding the Enterprise Agile & DevSecOps practices across Mondelez. You’ll ensure the entire Mondelez Digital Services teams are aligned to the Right Sized IT Delivery model that embraces best practices of Agile@Scale to drive high quality, frequent delivery of business outcomes at pace in collaboration with the wider Mondelez Digital Services teams, so that together we can deliver Enterprise Agility and accelerate business value. You’ll bring to bear your extensive experience advising organizations, leading by example and challenging the status quo to promote an environment and culture of continuous improvement, experimentation, and innovation. You’ll also be accountable for the team who provides training to support the implementation of the operating model; managing supporting tooling and optimising how it’s used and lead on the change management and communications to embed the change and grow an engaging people centric culture.

Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?
Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Matter.
In this role, you will lead core aspects of the global sustainability platform for Mondelēz International. You are responsible for evolving the sustainability strategic framework into an operational business building programs and embedding them into Mondelēz International’s way of doing business across the business units and the functions.
How you will contribute
You will contribute to the strategy development and implement programs to sustainably source key raw ingredients such as cocoa, wheat, and palm oil. In addition, you will oversee strategy development and execution of the company’s human rights due diligence approach and implement forced and child labor monitoring and remediation; partner with the Supply Chain to support strategies and execution of Mondelēz International’s carbon dioxide, water and waste programs, and build stronger relationships among Public and Government Affairs Center’s of Expertise and Business Units to provide strong and guiding input to regulatory positions. You will play a key role in the company’s external stakeholder engagement and investor relationships.

Title: Director Customer Solutions & Digital Innovation
Job_Description:
Overview:
IDC is seeking a Research Director with experience in Finance and within the Office of the Chief Financial Officer (CFO), to join the IDC team to conduct primary research, engage in quantitative research management, client engagement and business development. The Research Director will establish and maintain a strong presence within the technology and services spending areas around the Office of the CFOs buying preferences for the organization overall. This Research Director thought leader will look at the evolving dynamics of the Office of the CFO as it relates towards the future of the digital enterprise including technology and services objectives, priorities, programs, and investments. This individual should also be familiar with Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) as it pertains to the Office of the CFO. This individual will also work closely with the general business and technology trade press. It is essential for the Research Director to bring an innovative and creative perspective on the role technology and services are playing in the constantly evolving Office of the CFO.

Title: Global Finance Legal Operations Senior Analyst
Job_Description:
Overview:
IDC is seeking a Senior Research Analyst to join its Customer Insights and Analysis group. This individual will support the quantitative research programs on transformative and innovative technologies such as Augmented and Virtual Reality, Internet of Things and Edge Computing. The primary objective of this role is to identify, analyze and model technology buyer investment trends across multiple industries at a global and US regional basis.

The Senior Research Analyst will support and build quantitative models that synthesize economic, firmographic, and primary and secondary research data to size, forecast and segment technology markets by various parameters. This position requires collecting, analyzing and presenting vast amounts of data from different data sources to create compelling deliverables and actionable insights for major global technology vendors and investors.

Title: Global Finance Legal Operations Senior Analyst
Job_Description:
Overview:
IDG, Inc. is seeking a Corporate Senior Financial Analyst to join our team! Reporting to the Director of Corporate Finance, this role will be responsible for financial analysis and reporting at the business unit and corporate level. A successful candidate should possess advanced skills in financial and data analysis, including proficiency with three-statement financial modeling and understanding of generally accepted accounting principles. Additionally, the candidate should exhibit strong written and speaking skills, and have experience working cross-functionally to move related projects forward. The role will include oversight within Corporate Finance of all financial analysis and reporting activities including the general and custom development of reporting within our new D365 ERP system currently being implemented. They will support related financial and corporate decision makers at all levels of IDG, Inc. They will also work closely with management to meet their financial objectives.

At IDG, Inc. we are committed to building relationships through trusted content and data. Our rigorous standards, rich history in the IT industry, and connected global teams serve as the foundation for our continued growth. At the core of IDG, Inc. is a corporate team of experienced professionals that provide integrated, innovative solutions to help our partners navigate the ever-changing business landscape.
